      First, the first part's code:

      #include <stdio.h>
      #include <stdlib.h>
      #include <limits.h>

      // Define the Task structure
      typedef struct {
          int time;
          int duration;
          int index;
      } Task;

      // Queue implementation using array
      #define MAX_QUEUE_SIZE 100000 // arbitrary large enough size

      typedef struct {
          int items[MAX_QUEUE_SIZE];
          int front;
          int rear;
      } Queue;

      void initQueue(Queue *q) {
          q->front = -1;
          q->rear = -1;
      }

      int isEmpty(Queue *q) {
          return q->front == -1;
      }

      int isFull(Queue *q) {
          return (q->rear + 1) % MAX_QUEUE_SIZE == q->front;
      }

      void enqueue(Queue *q, int item) {
          if (isFull(q)) {
              // handle error, but assuming it won't happen as per problem constraints
              return;
          }
          if (isEmpty(q)) {
              q->front = q->rear = 0;
          } else {
              q->rear = (q->rear + 1) % MAX_QUEUE_SIZE;
          }
          q->items[q->rear] = item;
      }

      int dequeue(Queue *q) {
          if (isEmpty(q)) {
              return -1; // error
          }
          int item = q->items[q->front];
          if (q->front == q->rear) {
              initQueue(q);
          } else {
              q->front = (q->front + 1) % MAX_QUEUE_SIZE;
          }
          return item;
      }

      int size(Queue *q) {
          if (isEmpty(q)) return 0;
          return (q->rear - q->front + MAX_QUEUE_SIZE) % MAX_QUEUE_SIZE + 1;
      }

      // Function to process the first part
      void processFirstPart(int n, int b, Task tasks[], int result[]) {
          Queue q;
          initQueue(&q);
          int finish_time = 0;

          for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
              Task *task = &tasks[i];
              result[i] = 0;

              if (task->time > finish_time && isEmpty(&q)) {
                  // process immediately
                  finish_time = task->time + task->duration;
                  result[i] = finish_time;
              } else {
                  // check if task's time >= finish_time and queue not empty
                  if (task->time >= finish_time && !isEmpty(&q)) {
                      // run the first task in the queue
                      int index = dequeue(&q);
                      Task *currentTask = &tasks[index];
                      int start = (finish_time > currentTask->time) ? finish_time : currentTask->time;
                      finish_time = start + currentTask->duration;
                      result[currentTask->index] = finish_time;
                  }

                  // check if queue has space
                  if (size(&q) < b) {
                      enqueue(&q, i);
                  } else {
                      result[i] = -1;
                  }
              }
          }

          // process remaining tasks in the queue
          while (!isEmpty(&q)) {
              int index = dequeue(&q);
              Task *currentTask = &tasks[index];
              int start = (finish_time > currentTask->time) ? finish_time : currentTask->time;
              finish_time = start + currentTask->duration;
              result[currentTask->index] = finish_time;
          }
      }

      // Second part's function
      int computeSecondPart(int n) {
          int l = 1, r = n;
          while (l < r) {
              int mid = l + (r - l) / 2;
              long long idxcnt = (long long)mid * (mid + 1) / 2;
              if (idxcnt < n) {
                  l = mid + 1;
              } else {
                  r = mid;
              }
          }
          l -= 1;
          long long idxcnt = (long long)l * (l + 1) / 2;
          return n - idxcnt;
      }

      // Third part's variables and functions
      #define LIMIT 10000000000LL
      #define MAX_NUMBERS 500

      long long numbers[MAX_NUMBERS];
      int count = 0;

      void generate(long long num, int four, int seven) {
          if (num > LIMIT) return;
          if (num != 0 && four == seven) {
              numbers[count++] = num;
          }
          generate(num * 10 + 4, four + 1, seven);
          generate(num * 10 + 7, four, seven + 1);
      }

      int findSmallestGE(long long target) {
          int low = 0, high = count - 1;
          int res = -1;
          while (low <= high) {
              int mid = low + (high - low) / 2;
              if (numbers[mid] >= target) {
                  res = mid;
                  high = mid - 1;
              } else {
                  low = mid + 1;
              }
          }
          return res;
      }

      int main() {
          // Read first part's input
          int n, b;
          scanf("%d %d", &n, &b);

          Task tasks[n];
          for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
              int time, duration;
              scanf("%d %d", &time, &duration);
              tasks[i].time = time;
              tasks[i].duration = duration;
              tasks[i].index = i;
          }

          int result[n];
          processFirstPart(n, b, tasks, result);

          // Get the first element of the result (result[0])
          int first_output = result[0];

          // Compute second part
          int second_output = computeSecondPart(first_output);

          // Generate third part's numbers
          count = 0;
          generate(0, 0, 0);
          qsort(numbers, count, sizeof(long long), compare); // need to define compare function

          // Wait, need to sort the numbers array. Let's define a compare function.

          int compare(const void *a, const void *b) {
              return (*(long long*)a - *(long long*)b);
          }

          // Wait, but in C, the compare function must be declared before use. So better to define it outside.

          // So, let me adjust:

          // Define the compare function outside main
          int compare(const void *a, const void *b) {
              return (*(long long*)a - *(long long*)b);
          }

          // Back to main:

          qsort(numbers, count, sizeof(numbers[0]), compare);

          // Find the smallest number >= second_output
          int idx = findSmallestGE(second_output);
          if (idx != -1) {
              printf("%lld\n", numbers[idx]);
          } else {
              // No such number, but according to the problem, there should be one.
              // Since the numbers are generated up to 1e10, but the input could be up to 1e10, so the last element is 7777777777 (if needed).
              // So this case shouldn't happen.
              printf("%lld\n", numbers[count-1]);
          }

          return 0;
      }
